a machine readable transcription

address.addrLine: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

availability.p: The text of the original document is in the public domain. Subject to certain exceptions, public domain works may be freely copied or used in the creation of derivative works without permission, or authorization, of the former copyright owners.

The text encoding was created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and is governed by a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

note.p: Manuscript draft of a poem first appearing in print in the New York Herald, April 23, 1888 entitled "To-day and Thee". A note in the top margin: "sent April 21 to Herald" indicates that the draft was likely completed around the time of publication.

bibl.author: Whitman, Walt
bibl.title: To Day

bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

lg.head: To Day ? To–Day and Thee
lg.l:
The past entire with all its heroes, historie's
arts,

AllIts brownstore of songs, inventions, voyages, teachers,
and books,

The course of time and nations — Egypt
as and PalestineIndia and Greece, and and
Rome, the medieval growth

The medieval growth, science battles for
liberty, modern ssiencescience:

l.del:
All for to–day and thee — thou art the
heir of all.

lg.l:
To think of it!! — — All for & thee — to–day — the
heir ‸of all concentrates— to think of it! — in thee!

body.note: The ‸appointed winners in the long-stretch'd game
